gwt.g2d.client.graphics
Enum LineJoin

java.lang.Object
  java.lang.Enum<LineJoin>
      gwt.g2d.client.graphics.LineJoin
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Comparable<LineJoin>
public enum LineJoin
extends java.lang.Enum<LineJoin>

Defines the type of corners that UAs will place where two lines meet.

A join exists at any point in a subpath shared by two consecutive lines. When a subpath is closed, then a join also exists at its first point (equivalent to its last point) connecting the first and last lines in the subpath.

Author:
hao1300@gmail.com
See Also:
http://dev.w3.org/html5/spec/Overview.html#dom-context-2d-linejoin

Enum Constant Summary
BEVEL
          This value means that this is all that is rendered at joins.
MITER
          This value means that a second filled triangle must (if it can given the miter length) be rendered at the join, with one line being the line between the two aforementioned corners, abutting the first triangle, and the other two being continuations of the outside edges of the two joining lines, as long as required to intersect without going over the miter length.
ROUND
          This value means that a filled arc connecting the two aforementioned corners of the join, abutting (and not overlapping) the aforementioned triangle, with the diameter equal to the line width and the origin at the point of the join, must be rendered at joins.

Enum Constant Detail

BEVEL

public static final LineJoin BEVEL
This value means that this is all that is rendered at joins.

MITER

public static final LineJoin MITER
This value means that a second filled triangle must (if it can given the miter length) be rendered at the join, with one line being the line between the two aforementioned corners, abutting the first triangle, and the other two being continuations of the outside edges of the two joining lines, as long as required to intersect without going over the miter length. (This is the default LineJoin value).

ROUND

public static final LineJoin ROUND
This value means that a filled arc connecting the two aforementioned corners of the join, abutting (and not overlapping) the aforementioned triangle, with the diameter equal to the line width and the origin at the point of the join, must be rendered at joins.
